Section.Summary: The GUI class is the interface for Unity's GUI with manual positioning.

member.name: backgroundColor
member.summary: Global tinting color for all background elements rendered by the GUI.

member.name: changed
member.summary: Returns true if any controls changed the value of the input data.

member.name: color
member.summary: Global tinting color for the GUI.

member.name: contentColor
member.summary: Tinting color for all text rendered by the GUI.

member.name: depth
member.summary: The sorting depth of the currently executing GUI behaviour.

member.name: enabled
member.summary: Is the GUI enabled?

member.name: matrix
member.summary: The GUI transform matrix.

member.name: skin
member.summary: The global skin to use.

member.name: tooltip
member.summary: The tooltip of the control the mouse is currently over, or which has keyboard focus. (Read Only).

member.name: BeginGroup
member.summary: Begin a group. Must be matched with a call to EndGroup.

member.name: BeginScrollView
member.summary: Begin a scrolling view inside your GUI.

member.name: Box
member.summary: Make a graphical box.

member.name: BringWindowToBack
member.summary: Bring a specific window to back of the floating windows.

member.name: BringWindowToFront
member.summary: Bring a specific window to front of the floating windows.

member.name: Button
member.summary: Make a single press button. The user clicks them and something happens immediately.

member.name: DragWindow
member.summary: Make a window draggable.

member.name: DrawTexture
member.summary: Draw a texture within a rectangle.

member.name: DrawTextureWithTexCoords
member.summary: Draw a texture within a rectangle with the given texture coordinates. Use this function for clipping or tiling the image within the given rectangle.

member.name: EndGroup
member.summary: End a group.

member.name: EndScrollView
member.summary: Ends a scrollview started with a call to BeginScrollView.

member.name: FocusControl
member.summary: Move keyboard focus to a named control.

member.name: FocusWindow
member.summary: Make a window become the active window.

member.name: GetNameOfFocusedControl
member.summary: Get the name of named control that has focus.

member.name: HorizontalScrollbar
member.summary: Make a horizontal scrollbar. Scrollbars are what you use to scroll through a document. Most likely, you want to use scrollViews instead.

member.name: HorizontalSlider
member.summary: A horizontal slider the user can drag to change a value between a min and a max.

member.name: Label
member.summary: Make a text or texture label on screen.

member.name: PasswordField
member.summary: Make a text field where the user can enter a password.

member.name: RepeatButton
member.summary: Make a button that is active as long as the user holds it down.

member.name: ScrollTo
member.summary: Scrolls all enclosing scrollviews so they try to make position visible.

member.name: SelectionGrid
member.summary: Make a grid of buttons.

member.name: SetNextControlName
member.summary: Set the name of the next control.

member.name: TextArea
member.summary: Make a Multi-line text area where the user can edit a string.

member.name: TextField
member.summary: Make a single-line text field where the user can edit a string.

member.name: Toggle
member.summary: Make an on/off toggle button.

member.name: Toolbar
member.summary: Make a toolbar.

member.name: UnfocusWindow
member.summary: Remove focus from all windows.

member.name: VerticalScrollbar
member.summary: Make a vertical scrollbar. Scrollbars are what you use to scroll through a document. Most likely, you want to use scrollViews instead.

member.name: VerticalSlider
member.summary: A vertical slider the user can drag to change a value between a min and a max.

member.name: Window
member.summary: Make a popup window.
